| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | [monst.c#line2113](/wiki/Monst.c#line2113 "Monst.c") |

A **kobold zombie**, Z, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [zombified](/wiki/Zombie "Zombie") [kobold](/wiki/Kobold "Kobold") that is the weakest monster in the [zombie](/wiki/Zombie_\(monster_class\) "Zombie (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"), and is likely to be one of the first you will encounter. Kobold zombies can [follow](/wiki/Follow "Follow") [you](/wiki/You "You") to other levels if they are adjacent to you.

A kobold zombie has a single claw attack.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated kobold zombies are always hostile.

Kobold zombies may appear among the zombies and other monsters that are part of the first quest monster class for [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Priest quest](/wiki/Priest_quest "Priest quest"). The branch also has several undead-filled graveyards that include kobold zombies among their ranks.

A kobold zombie will leave an aged [kobold](/wiki/Kobold "Kobold") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") upon death.[\[1\]](#cite_note-undead_to_corpse-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-make_corpse-2)

## Strategy

Kobold zombies are pushovers compared to live kobolds, and are among the easier early monsters for most roles to handle - they cannot use items of any kind, and their claw attack is quite manageable.

For neutral [protection racketeers](/wiki/Protection_racket "Protection racket"), kobold zombies are the most ideal early monsters to encounter and kill directly, as killing cross-aligned hostile monsters enables safe [prayer](/wiki/Pray "Pray") and boosts [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record"): zombies are among the few early options available, and the kobold zombie is very unlikely to provide an [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") since it gives only one experience point.

## History

The kobold zombie first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), where most of the various zombies are first distinguished from each other.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), kobold zombies can be created by using the [raise zombies](/wiki/Raise_zombies "Raise zombies") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique") while adjacent to the corpse of any [kobold](/wiki/Kobold_\(monster_class\) "Kobold (monster class)") (including ones left by undead).

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), kobold zombies are replaced with the [zombie](/wiki/Zombie_\(GruntHack\) "Zombie (GruntHack)") [racial monster](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster"), which kobolds are eligible to generate as. Any non-undead kobold monster killed by a zombie will become a kobold zombie.

## Encyclopedia entry

The zombi ... is a soulless human corpse, still dead, but taken from the grave and endowed by sorcery with a mechanical semblance of life, -- it is a dead body which is made to walk and act and move as if it were alive.

\[ W. B. Seabrook ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-undead_to_corpse_1-0) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 147](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mon.c#L147): *Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-make_corpse_2-0) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 372](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mon.c#L372): *Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Kobold zombie

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Z kobold zombie
Difficulty 1
Attacks Claw 1d4
Z kobold zombie
Difficulty 1
Attacks

Claw 1d4

Base level 0
Base experience 1
Speed 6
Base AC 10
Base MR 0
Alignment -2 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 400
Nutritional value 50
Size Small
Resistances Cold, sleep, poison
Resistances conveyed None

A kobold zombie:

  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is undead.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • has infravision.
  • can leave an old kobold corpse.
Reference monst.c#line2113

A kobold zombie, Z, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a zombified kobold that is the weakest monster in the zombie monster class, and is likely to be one of the first you will encounter. Kobold zombies can follow you to other levels if they are adjacent to you.

A kobold zombie has a single claw attack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 GruntHack
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

Randomly generated kobold zombies are always hostile.

Kobold zombies may appear among the zombies and other monsters that are part of the first quest monster class for Priests, and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Priest quest. The branch also has several undead-filled graveyards that include kobold zombies among their ranks.

A kobold zombie will leave an aged kobold corpse upon death.[1][2]

Strategy

Kobold zombies are pushovers compared to live kobolds, and are among the easier early monsters for most roles to handle - they cannot use items of any kind, and their claw attack is quite manageable.

For neutral protection racketeers, kobold zombies are the most ideal early monsters to encounter and kill directly, as killing cross-aligned hostile monsters enables safe prayer and boosts alignment record: zombies are among the few early options available, and the kobold zombie is very unlikely to provide an experience level since it gives only one experience point.

History

The kobold zombie first appears in NetHack 3.0.0, where most of the various zombies are first distinguished from each other.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, kobold zombies can be created by using the raise zombies technique while adjacent to the corpse of any kobold (including ones left by undead).

GruntHack

In GruntHack, kobold zombies are replaced with the zombie racial monster, which kobolds are eligible to generate as. Any non-undead kobold monster killed by a zombie will become a kobold zombie.

Encyclopedia entry

The zombi ... is a soulless human corpse, still dead, but taken from the grave and endowed by sorcery with a mechanical semblance of life, -- it is a dead body which is made to walk and act and move as if it were alive.

[ W. B. Seabrook ]

References

  1. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 147: Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts
  2. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 372: Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops

A '''kobold zombie''', {{monsym|kobold zombie}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a [[Zombie|zombified]] [[kobold]] that is the weakest monster in the [[Zombie (monster class)|zombie]] [[monster class]], and is likely to be one of the first you will encounter. Kobold zombies can [[follow]] [[you]] to other levels if they are adjacent to you.

A kobold zombie has a single claw attack.

==Generation==
Randomly generated kobold zombies are always hostile.

Kobold zombies may appear among the zombies and other monsters that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Priest]]s, and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [[Priest quest]]. The branch also has several undead-filled graveyards that include kobold zombies among their ranks.

A kobold zombie will leave an aged [[kobold]] [[corpse]] upon death.{{refsrc|src/mon.c|147|nethack=3.6.7|name="undead_to_corpse"|comment=Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts}}{{refsrc|src/mon.c|372|nethack=3.6.7|name="make_corpse"|comment=Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops}}

==Strategy==
Kobold zombies are pushovers compared to live kobolds, and are among the easier early monsters for most roles to handle - they cannot use items of any kind, and their claw attack is quite manageable.

For neutral [[protection racket]]eers, kobold zombies are the most ideal early monsters to encounter and kill directly, as killing cross-aligned hostile monsters enables safe [[pray]]er and boosts [[alignment record]]: zombies are among the few early options available, and the kobold zombie is very unlikely to provide an [[experience level]] since it gives only one experience point.

==History==
The kobold zombie first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]], where most of the various zombies are first distinguished from each other.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], kobold zombies can be created by using the [[raise zombies]] [[technique]] while adjacent to the corpse of any [[Kobold (monster class)|kobold]] (including ones left by undead).

===GruntHack===
In [[GruntHack]], kobold zombies are replaced with the [[Zombie (GruntHack)|zombie]] [[racial monster]], which kobolds are eligible to generate as. Any non-undead kobold monster killed by a zombie will become a kobold zombie.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|The zombi ... is a soulless human corpse, still dead, but taken from the grave and endowed by sorcery with a mechanical semblance of life, -- it is a dead body which is made to walk and act and move as if it were alive.
|[ W. B. Seabrook ]
}}
